8.27.22  2:23 pm   What makes a song sound like it's in A minor rather than C major, considering they have the same seven notes?

      when it hits A in the bass, that's when it will sound like A minor. that's why some songs in A minor when played on your iphone or other flat speaker (without headphones) actually sound like they're in C. weird. composers beware of this

      impossible. it can't be done

8.27.22  1:08 pm   do you game?

      i am game

8.27.22  12:46 pm   do you think instrumental music can convey as much (or in some cases more) emotional impact or story to the listener as music with lyrics? i think it's a little sad that most people are aversive to listening to instrumentals by themselves.

      music without words, scenes, or any other context, works mostly on your feelings and emotions, in a way that can be difficult to grasp if there's nothing to hold onto. it's extremely powerful, but it needs something to hold it. words can do this, scenes can do this, almost anything the music is attached to, can help hold the music and put it into context, and activate all of its power. and, at the same time, the music will greatly enhance the power of the thing it's attached to. Think of it like this: music is the beverage. the context/words/scene is the cup. imagine a beverage with no cup. same beverage...... undrinkable. Also, a cup without a beverage can be pretty bland also. Instead of being disappointed about this, i think you'll find it extremely rewarding to become a cupsmith. you'll be doing wonders for all different kinds of music, and cups as well. it's a win-win

8.27.22  12:18 pm   opinion on making a song about when you get younger (when I get older's younger sequel)

      there is already a verse for that, in "when i get older"

      how about some recreational activities

8.27.22  8:38 am   do you make other people listen to your music to see their opinion on it before releasing it?

      no

8.27.22  6:32 am   i'm looking to get a keyboard for music production, what is your choice? i'm looking for a pretty cheap one (200-300 bucks) that has lots of different noises on it

     i don't really know anything about the keyboard market, but, my personal issue is that i think dynamic sensitivity is crucial. this is all i'm saying: make sure it sounds different whether you play the note hard or soft. some of the really cheap ones have the loud and soft notes exactly the same volume. this will make you sad and you won't know why. it will make you think you suck, even if you don't

8.27.22  1:35 am   what's your favorite type of cloud that hasn't been discovered yet?

      i don't know

      even better. subjectivity is truthful

      no

8.26.22  10:09 pm   When did nothing start?

      it starts when each 'thing' ends, as long as there is no other thing next

8.26.22  9:53 pm   is 'the ending' a song about the creation of the song itself

      mostly. i bet most of my songs are about that

8.26.22  9:19 pm   is there a way to be bad at music?

      there's probably no way NOT to be bad at music. even if you're good

8.26.22  9:16 pm   How do I tell if a feather hat is worthy of a conversation or not?

      it is. every hat is worthy of a conversation. every thing is worthy of a conversation. conversations are worthy of conversation

      roundhay garden scene

8.26.22  8:06 pm   I seem to be giving off weird vibes this week. How can I make it not-offputting to others?

      just wait it out, while focusing on something else you may be interested in

8.26.22  6:45 pm   is sincerity a weapon that can be used to combat the digital mundane, or is escapism and irony preferable, as it leads to a balance between pseudo-presence and pseudo-isolation as a method of coping with said mundane?

      sincerity and satire both truly do a romantic dance, making the world go round actually

8.26.22  5:42 pm   do you cringe at your own voice

      yes but i don't use those takes

8.26.22  5:15 pm   how did you create that high pitched "twee-te-te-te-te" melodic sound in that part of the ending starting at "it makes me weep, skip, sing it while I sleep"? it sounds like a pitched up keyboard but i can't be sure. it's very fanciful and cool sounding though

      it's just a keyboard sound that's fairly dull and gets out of the way quickly. the entire rhythm of the sound is me actually playing all those notes in real time. use 2 or 3 fingers on the same note. if it helps, you can slow the tempo down to record it but i don't do that. it's more important how it's played than what sound it is. i know this because i used to do this all the time on a different sound that i no longer have access to, and i just recently started doing it again and i was very quickly able to find a sound that works fine for that. just has to be slightly dull and get out of the way quickly (short release). and the rest is all in the performance

8.26.22  5:07 pm   good evening i just remembered all the questions i wanted to ask you the other day , but forgot to. i will keep these questions and ask you another time! i do however, have two i'd like to ask you now: if i'm writing lots of very short pieces of music, usually a few seconds in length, can i just keep doing that knowing they aren't complete?

     sure. maybe they are complete, maybe they are not, but either way you can file them and continue

     is there a principle i can hold true that might help me get some of these pieces completed? thanks again, e

     if they are incomplete, yes, you can complete them. what helped for me is to recognize that these are 2 entirely different jobs. even today, i consider them different jobs. there is even a 3rd job called 'selection', and actually there is even a 4th job called 'middle writing' and for that i do the selection randomly, and in that case i wouldn't be required to finish the item, just move it along a little bit

      you can't. an acorn is forever

8.26.22  3:11 pm   did you ever invent something?

      tell me what it is

      when i was in school i wrapped a rubber band longways around a ruler and used it as a 1-string guitar. i'm sure i'm not the first person who has done this, but i came up with the idea on my own

      no. i will be doing that more soon, but the title of the most recent song has no relation to that situation. the reason the song is called "the ending" is because it's in the lyrics to the song

8.26.22  11:05 am   if you could make up a word what would it be

      i can make up words, and i make up many. so i suppose i should answer this with the earliest one i can think of, which is the word "joj", which is a verb, and it's like in a movie when people sort of roll down a hill. the idea for this word came from seeing the upside down reflection of a digital clock showing "7:07"
